How You Can Help Community Cats in Brooks County: Your Guide to Making a Real Difference

Every day, community cats in Barney and northern Brooks County need our help. Whether you're a long-time animal lover or someone who's just noticed cats in your neighborhood, there are meaningful ways you can contribute to improving their lives.

Every day, community cats in Barney and northern Brooks County need our help. Whether you're a long-time animal lover or someone who's just noticed cats in your neighborhood, there are meaningful ways you can contribute to improving their lives. At Sam's TNR, we believe that collective community action creates lasting change.

Why Your Help Matters

1000s

Community cats in Brooks County

180

Kittens one unspayed female can produce

250+

Cats Sam's TNR has helped

‚àû

Future kittens prevented

üôã‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Volunteer Opportunities: Hands-On Ways to Help

Trapping Volunteers

Time Commitment: Flexible, event-based

Help us humanely capture community cats for TNR services:

  • Learn proper trapping techniques from experienced volunteers
  • Assist with trap setup and monitoring in various locations
  • Transport cats to and from veterinary appointments
  • No experience necessary‚Äîwe provide full training

Perfect for: People who enjoy problem-solving, working outdoors, and direct animal care

Foster Volunteers

Time Commitment: 3-7 days per cat

Provide temporary care for cats recovering from surgery:

  • Quiet space in your home for post-surgery recovery
  • Basic care including feeding and medication if needed
  • Monitoring cats before they're returned to their colonies
  • Supplies provided by Sam's TNR

Perfect for: Animal lovers with space who enjoy nurturing care

Transportation Volunteers

Time Commitment: 2-4 hours per trip

Help cats get to veterinary appointments and back home:

  • Drive cats to veterinary clinics in Valdosta and surrounding areas
  • Pick up cats after surgery and transport to foster homes
  • Flexible scheduling based on your availability
  • Mileage reimbursement when possible

Perfect for: People with reliable transportation who want to help

Colony Caretakers

Time Commitment: Ongoing

Provide daily care for managed cat colonies:

  • Feed cats on a regular schedule
  • Monitor health and behavior of colony members
  • Alert Sam's TNR to new cats needing services
  • Maintain feeding stations and shelters

Perfect for: Dedicated individuals who want long-term commitment

üíù Donation Support: Every Dollar Makes a Difference

As a 501(c)(3) nonprofit, all donations to Sam's TNR are tax-deductible and go directly toward helping community cats.

Where Your Money Goes:

$25

Vaccines for One Cat

Rabies and FVRCP vaccinations to protect both cats and community health

$50

Spay/Neuter Surgery

Prevents one cat from reproducing and contributing to overpopulation

$75

Complete TNR Service

Full package: trapping, surgery, vaccinations, ear-tipping, and recovery care

$500

Sponsor a Small Colony

Complete TNR services for 6-7 cats in a single location

üè† Supporting Community Cats in Your Neighborhood

‚úÖ DO:

  • Contact Sam's TNR for assessment and TNR services
  • Provide food and water consistently if you're able
  • Create or improve shelter options
  • Monitor cats for signs of illness or injury
  • Keep feeding schedules regular

‚ùå DON'T:

  • Try to trap cats yourself without proper training
  • Feed cats irregularly (creates dependency without follow-through)
  • Attempt to socialize truly feral cats
  • Move cats to new locations (they know their territory)
